titleStmt.title: The siege of Rhodes made a representation by the art of prospective in scenes, and the story sung in recitative musick. At the Cock-pit in Drury Lane.
titleStmt.author: D'Avenant, William, Sir, 1606-1668.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A37187 of text R29700 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing D341). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 205 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 61 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by J.M. for Henry Herringman, and are to be sold at his shop, at the sign of the Anchor, in the Lower-walk in the New-Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Identified as Wing D341A on reel 1439 of UMI microfilm "Early English books, 1641-1700".
Reproductions of the originals in the Dyce Collection, Victoria and Albert Museum (reel 1846) and in the Harvard University Library (reel 1439).
